snippet.title: Kotlin Youtube - How to Quickly Fetch Parse JSON with OkHttp and Gson (Ep 2)
snippet.description:
Episode 1: https://youtu.be/jS0buQyfJfs

Today, we learn how to fetch JSON data and integrate it using Model objects in our application.  What's going to make our lives a lot easier is to use the help of OkHttp and Gson to fetch and parse our objects.  Once we construct a HomeFeed model containing a list of videos, we will modify MainAdapter to dynamically render our list using this REST api endpoint.  Enjoy.

HomeFeed Json Endpoint: https://api.letsbuildthatapp.com/youtube/home_feed

OkHttp: https://square.github.io/okhttp/
Gson: https://guides.codepath.com/android/leveraging-the-gson-library

Intermediate Training Core Data
https://www.letsbuildthatapp.com/course/intermediate-training-core-data

Instagram Firebase Course
https://www.letsbuildthatapp.com/course/instagram-firebase
